title: Behind the Idea #62: Lyft Driving Onto The Market's Map
description: Big IPOs attract attention as investments and also for what they mean in the economy at large. Lyft isn't the biggest IPO expected, but as a preview to Uber and as a company in its own right, it raises a lot of questions. We discuss whether there's a value to the company and a moat that will give it a competitive edge over the years to come.
itunes:title: Lyft Driving Onto The Market's Map
itunes:author: Seeking Alpha
itunes:subtitle: Is the ride-hailing company worth the hype? Are the bears overselling fears?

We discuss whether there's a value to the company and a moat that will give it a competitive edge over the years to come.
